data.enText: the feeling of liking or loving sb/sth very much and caring about them

data.chText: 达西先生对他妹妹的关爱之情
data.enText: Mr Darcy's affection for his sister

data.chText: 孩子需要多多疼爱和关怀。
data.enText: Children need lots of love and affection.

data.chText: 他没有向妻子表示一点爱。
data.enText: He didn't show his wife any affection .

data.chText: 她的学生都十分爱戴她。
data.enText: She was held in deep affection by all her students.
I have a great affection for New York.
Anne had two men trying to win her affections.

example: he had trouble expressing the affection he felt
the warmness of his welcome made us feel right at home

value.def: If you regard someone or something with affection, you like them and are fond of them.

example.ex: She thought of him with affection...
She had developed quite an affection for the place.
example.tran: 她逐渐对这个地方钟爱有加。

value.def: Your affections are your feelings of love or fondness for someone.

example.ex: The distant object of his affections is Caroline...
example.tran: 他一厢情愿地爱慕卡罗琳。

example.ex: Jack Russell has a special place in the affections of the cricketing public.
example.tran: 杰克·拉塞尔在打板球的人心中有着特殊的地位。

example.ex: ...her fear of being replaced in his affections.

trans: 人际交往感情；社会的倾向
